business.headline: India, US unveil interim trade pact; cuts tariffs, opens $30 trillion marketThe India-US trade deal marks a reset in trade ties, cutting Trump tariffs to 18 per cent and setting the stage for a sweeping bilateral deal amid geopolitical recalibrations.

US stocks hit historic milestone as Dow crosses 50,000 points for first timeUS stocks surged Friday as tech shares rebounded and bitcoin steadied, pushing the S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq sharply higher despite lingering worries over heavy AI spending and market volatility.

How Google rode the AI wave to cross $400 billion in annual revenue for 1st timeGoogle said that the Gemini app alone has crossed 750 million monthly active users, showing that AI adoption is no longer limited to developers or businesses.

Fractal Analytics, Aye Finance IPOs to open next week: What investors should knowInvestors will have two fresh IPO opportunities next week as Fractal Analytics and Aye Finance open their public issues on February 9. The offerings span technology and finance, drawing attention from those looking to diversify their portfolios.

Bitcoin crash stuns markets. Decoding biggest crypto slump since Trump electionBitcoin has witnessed one of its sharpest corrections in recent years, wiping out more than $2 trillion from the global cryptocurrency market in a single day. The fall is the steepest since Donald Trump's election. It comes amid rising global risk aversion, weakness in technology and AI stocks, and sustained institutional selling pressure.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to close higher; IT stocks bleed to limit gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 266.47 points to close at 83,580.40, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 50.90 points to end at 25,693.70.

Why Ola, Uber and Rapido drivers are going on a 6-hour strike todayThe strike has been called by the Telangana Gig and Platform Workers Union, also known as TGPWU. The union represents app-based transport workers operating on platforms such as Ola, Uber and Rapido.

Gold jumps Rs 1,000, silver falls Rs 6,000: Should you buy now or wait longer?Recent swings in gold and silver prices have caught investors' attention, with the metals showing mixed trends after a strong run. The big question now is whether this is a pause before the next move — should you buy now or wait longer?

Is Budget 2026 putting services at the centre of India's growth strategy?Budget 2026, in essence, quietly recognises that India's economic growth and job creation are and will continue to be powered by services – both tradable and non-tradable, while maintaining the focus on infrastructure and manufacturing.

Can RBI's new measures make it easier to do business and boost credit flow?With the RBI announcing new steps to improve credit access and ease regulations, attention is turning to their real-world impact. Could these changes help businesses grow and borrow more smoothly?

Why stock markets fell after RBI kept key lending rates unchanged Even though inflation is within the comfort band and growth remains robust, RBI signalled that it is not ready to shift toward a softer stance. Global uncertainties, from geopolitical tensions to commodity volatility, continue to influence the outlook.

RBI keeps repo rate unchanged, why its still a win-win situation for homebuyersWhile many homebuyers were hoping for a rate cut, the RBI decision to keep rates steady at 5.25% is not bad news, especially for those who value stability and clear planning.

RBI maintains 5.25% repo rate: What it means for homebuyers and EMIsThe RBI has decided to keep its key interest rate unchanged in its latest policy review. What could this steady stance mean for homebuyers and their monthly loan repayments?

RBI keeps key lending rates unchanged at 5.25% in last MPC of FY26The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) kept repo rate unchanged at 5.25% in the last meeting for Fy26. The RBI Governor said inflation trends have been supportive of keeping rates unchanged.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks continue fall; TCS, TechM down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex fell by 216.98 points to 83,097.00, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 80.25 points to 25,562.55 as of 9:48 am.

Bitcoin prices hit 16-month low: Will it fall below $60,000?Bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency, dropped to an intraday low of $60,008.52 during volatile trade. This was the weakest level seen since October 2024

RBI MPC announcement today: Will Governor Sanjay Malhotra reduce repo rate?In its December policy meeting, the Reserve Bank of India had reduced the repo rate by 25 basis points from 5.50% to 5.25%. At the same time, it retained a neutral policy stance.

India-EU trade deal and the gender blind spot in India's trade policyIntegrating gender considerations into trade policy design, implementation, and evaluation is therefore essential—not only to ensure that trade works for women, but to ensure that trade works better overall.

India–Nigeria ties key to shaping a stronger global southBy working closely through diplomatic engagement, trade and cultural cooperation, Musawa believes that both nations can play a leading role in shaping a future where developing countries have a louder voice on the world stage.

Peace, partnerships and progress top agenda for Caribbean nationsSpeaking to India Today at the World Governments Summit, Wheatley and Mitchell highlighted the importance of peace, economic diversification and stronger global partnerships for Caribbean nations.

entertainment.headline: Guns down, emotions up: The return of family dramas in Tamil cinema Tamil cinema in 2025 witnessed a strong resurgence of family dramas focusing on emotional storytelling. This shift reflects evolving audience preferences and a move away from spectacle films towards authentic, relatable narratives.

After blaming Kanye for health woes, Kim Kardashian says they'll always be family Kim Kardashian and Kanye West, who divorced five years ago, have shared new perspectives on their relationship, with Kim calling them 'always family' and Kanye issuing a public apology for past behaviour linked to mental health challenges.

Rohit Shetty's Khatron Ke Khiladi returns with Season 15, makers release AI promo Khatron Ke Khiladi will return to Colors TV for its fifteenth season after a two-year break, with the announcement made through an AI-generated promo video.

Raveena Ravi names alleged harassers after years of complaints, seeks public support Actor and voice artist Raveena Ravi exposed two men for harassing her and her family for three years, urging authorities to take strict action following ongoing incidents despite previous police complaints.

Samay Raina jokes on free speech: India takes the comic, US takes the audience Samay Raina spoke to India Today about his new show Still Alive, police case over comedians and US President Donald Trump. He also expressed his excitement about performing at Madison Square Garden.

Samay Raina on performing at Madison Square, US President Donald Trump and more In an interview with India Today, comedian Samay Raina discusses his show Still Alive and performing at Madison Square Garden. Reflecting on past legal controversies, Raina humorously compares performing in India and the US, while explaining how personal resilience fuelled his latest unscripted performance.

Priyanka Chopra on Nick Jonas' Sunday Best: You're the most honest person I know Priyanka Chopra dedicated an emotional note to husband Nick Jonas following the release of his new album Sunday Best. Praising his "endless talent" and sincerity, the actor expressed pride in his work while preparing for her own upcoming releases in the film and the genre.

Pankaj Tripathi on Arijit quitting playback singing: We are not factory products Pankaj Tripathi has backed Arijit Singh's decision to quit playback singing, highlighting the vital need for artistic breaks. Emphasising that creators are not "factory products," the actor said that slowing down is essential for personal reinvention and maintaining excitement in a demanding profession.

Singer Chinmayi backs Arjun Kapoor after emotional post on online bullying Singer Chinmayi Sripaada publicly supported Arjun Kapoor amid concerns about harsh social media trolling, following the actor's candid post about difficult times.

Ashakal Aayiram review: Jayaram-Kalidas shine, but film falls short of greatnessRelease Date:Fri Feb 06, 2026 Ashakal Aayiram movie review: Director G Prajith's Ashakal Aayiram, starring Jayaram and Kalidas Jayaram, is an attempt at a heartwarming film about a dad-son's passion and ego issues. The film has interesting ideas, but falls short of greatness.

Taylor Swift's Opalite video packs cameos and peak '90s nostalgia. Watch Taylor Swift has released the quirky and nostalgic music video for Opalite exclusively on Spotify and Apple Music, opting to skip YouTube for now. The video features a star-studded cast and blends humour with retro kitsch, reflecting themes of emotional survival and happiness in true Swift style.

Anomie review: Bhavana starrer crime thriller is high concept, low impactRelease Date:Fri Feb 06, 2026 Anomie: The Equation of Death is a Malayalam crime thriller starring Bhavana Menon in the lead. The film, directed by debutant Riyaz Marath, is a below-average crime thriller that promises gold but only delivers brass (in slow motion).

Euphoria review: Strong themes, uneven storytelling in Gunasekhar's social dramaRelease Date:Fri Feb 06, 2026 Euphoria marks Gunasekhar's shift from visual spectacle to a hard-hitting social drama, but uneven execution keeps its powerful ideas from fully landing.

YRF breaks silence on Mardaani 3 being linked to Delhi's missing girls report Yash Raj Films responded to allegations that it used reports of missing girls in Delhi to amplify promotions for the film Mardaani 3, starring Rani Mukerji. It denied any deliberate sensationalism of the sensitive issue.

Steve Carell returns to TV with HBO campus comedy Rooster. Watch trailer HBO's new comedy series Rooster, starring Steve Carell and Charly Clive, is set to premiere on 8 March and will explore the dynamics between an author and his daughter on a college campus.

Director Lenin Bharathi labels Rajinikanth 'fake philanthropist' over charity act Filmmaker Lenin Bharathi has criticised Rajinikanth calling him a 'fake philanthropist' after gifting a gold chain to a sanitation worker.

Yash's Toxic sells Andhra Pradesh-Telangana distribution rights for Rs 120 crore Sri Venkateswara Creations secured Andhra Pradesh and Telangana rights for Toxic in a landmark Rs 120 crore deal, the highest ever for a non-Telugu origin film, highlighting strong industry confidence in the upcoming release.

Ruby Bhatia, who earned Rs 1 lakh per show, says she makes Rs 1,000 a video now Video jockey Ruby Bhatia addressed public speculation about her financial situation. In a recent interview, she explained her low fees for Instagram videos and her preference for a quieter, more manageable way of life amid rising expenses.

The Raja Saab on OTT: JioHotstar crashes ahead of film's digital release The digital launch of Prabhas' horror comedy The Raja Saab on JioHotstar led to a record-breaking surge in platform traffic, resulting in technical disruptions and prompting the streamer to enhance its server capacity.

general news.headline: India, US unveil interim trade pact; cuts tariffs, opens $30 trillion marketThe India-US trade deal marks a reset in trade ties, cutting Trump tariffs to 18 per cent and setting the stage for a sweeping bilateral deal amid geopolitical recalibrations.

Didn't make a mistake: Trump won't apologise for video depicting Obamas as apesThe one-minute video was posted late Thursday night on Truth Social and stayed online for nearly 12 hours before being removed amid bipartisan outrage, including criticism from Trump allies.

Why Ola, Uber and Rapido drivers are going on a 6-hour strike todayThe strike has been called by the Telangana Gig and Platform Workers Union, also known as TGPWU. The union represents app-based transport workers operating on platforms such as Ola, Uber and Rapido.

Somewhere between rift and rain, T20 World Cup begins for PakistanThe ICC T20 World Cup begins with Pakistan taking on Netherlands in the curtain-raiser. Between rift with ICC and tricky conditions, do Pakistan have it in them to focus on the match?

Voting for Jamaat is haram: Islamist Hefazat launches jihad on Bangladesh poll eveJust days before Bangladesh votes, rival Islamist groups have turned the election into a showdown. The Hefazat-e-Islam has declared jihad against the Islamist Jamaat-e-Islami, saying voting for it is "haram". Hefazat is backing the Tarique Rahman-led Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP).

India's 'home-grown ills' dig at Pak after neighbour's blame for mosque blastIndia on Friday condemned the suicide bombing at a mosque in Islamabad, expressed condolences to the victims, and firmly rejected Pakistan's attempt to blame external forces for the attack.

How a WhatsApp message fuelled Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's 175 in the finalA quiet WhatsApp reminder from his childhood coach preceded a night of calculated brutality. 14-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi dismantled England in the U19 World Cup final, hitting 175, including 15 sixes and as many boundaries in Harare on Friday.

Delhi's Janakpuri tragedy: Biker called friend minutes before falling to his deathKamal, a resident of Kailashpuri, had left his office in Rohini on Thursday night but never reached home. His family searched for him through the night, along with police teams, but no trace of him could be found. Around 8 am on Friday, a woman reportedly called the police to inform them about a body lying inside a 15-foot-deep pit in Janakpuri. Police personnel reached the spot and found Kamal's body inside the pit, with his bike toppled nearby.

Shashi Tharoor's sassy reel on 'not so minor' injury charms internetSenior Congress leader and MP Shashi Tharoor shared a light-hearted Instagram reel reacting humorously to a minor injury sustained during the Budget session.

US slaps sanctions on Iran's secret oil fleet as nuclear talks restart in OmanThe US imposed fresh sanctions on Iran's shadow oil network, targeting vessels and traders accused of funding repression and terrorism, as Tehran and Washington held indirect nuclear talks in Oman.

Anti-India Islamist party promises shining Bangladesh with borrowed Indian picsIndia Today Fact Check found that Bangladesh's Jamaat-e-Islami used photographs from India in its election manifesto to showcase its vision for Bangladesh.
Confused by conflicting reports on missing Delhi children? Here's all you need to knowIndia Today Fact Check went through the many claims and counterclaims to cut through the noise.

Samay Raina jokes on free speech: India takes the comic, US takes the audienceSamay Raina spoke to India Today about his new show Still Alive, police case over comedians and US President Donald Trump. He also expressed his excitement about performing at Madison Square Garden.

ICE's Worst of the Worst list has 89 Indians, most convicted of financial fraudThe US Department of Homeland Security has released a database listing immigrants arrested by ICE and convicted for a range of offences. The database, which has at least 25,000 entries, also lists the names of 89 Indian offenders arrested for crimes ranging from financial fraud to sexual offences.

Gutter law in Pakistan: 10-year jail, Rs 50 lakh fine for manhole cover theftPakistan's Punjab government, led by Maryam Nawaz Sharif, has proposed a tough "Gutter Law" with up to 10 years' jail and fines of Rs 50 lakh to curb rampant manhole cover thefts that have turned uncovered drains into deadly hazards.

17 Indian students killed in violent attacks in Canada since 2018: GovtParliament was told that 17 Indian students died in violent attacks in Canada between 2018 and 2025, prompting the government to outline safety measures, consular support and evacuation efforts abroad.

Internet spots Hamza in Balochistan: BLA's Pak attack clip has shades of DhurandharHandcrafted ByOur Editors When Baloch fighters went out to launch decades' deadliest attack on Pakistan, the visuals looked straight out of Dhurandhar. The visual was uncanny: wind-swept desert, militant gear, flowing beard, unhurried swagger, eyes fixed forward, making the internet believe 'Balochistan has its own Hamza Ali Mazari.'

Bomber was stopped by guards, blew self up killing 50: All about Islamabad blastA suicide bomber killed at least 50 people and injured over 150 after being stopped by security guards at the gate of a Shi'ite mosque in Islamabad during Friday prayers.

British man, 76, sentenced to 24 years for drugging children for sexual abuseA retired British veterinarian was sentenced to nearly 24 years in prison for drugging children with sedatives hidden in candy and sexually abusing them at a summer camp.

Agni-3: India test fires missile that can strike up to 3,000 kmIndia successfully test-fired the Agni-3 intermediate-range ballistic missile from Odisha on February 6, validating its operational readiness under the Strategic Forces Command.

Guns down, emotions up: The return of family dramas in Tamil cinemaTamil cinema in 2025 witnessed a strong resurgence of family dramas focusing on emotional storytelling. This shift reflects evolving audience preferences and a move away from spectacle films towards authentic, relatable narratives.

T20 World Cup: Mohammed Siraj replaces injured Harshit Rana in India's squadIndia have named senior pacer Mohammed Siraj as Harshit Rana's replacement after the fast bowler was ruled out of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 with a knee injury sustained during a warm-up match.

Pune entrepreneur, 59, jumps from high-rise, incident caught on cameraSunil Motilal Sadarangani, a renowned entrepreneur and owner of Multani Bakery in Solapur, tragically ended his life by jumping from a building in Pune.

sports.headline: IND vs USA: India begin bid for history in Green Card vs Aadhaar Card clash T20 World Cup 2026, India vs USA: Defending champions India will kick off their ICC Men's T20 World Cup campaign against a multicultural USA side at Mumbai's iconic Wankhede Stadium. With eight members of the USA squad tracing their roots back to India, Saturday's clash has been colloquially billed as Green Card versus Aadhaar Card.

Matchday Preview: Forgotten heroes West Indies begin campaign with India, Pakistan T20 World Cup 2026: Matchday preview: The opening day of the T20 World Cup 2026 will feature three fixtures, namely Pakistan vs Netherlands, West Indies vs Scotland and India vs USA. Here's our match-wise guide for the opening day of the tournament

Somewhere between rift and rain, T20 World Cup begins for Pakistan The ICC T20 World Cup begins with Pakistan taking on Netherlands in the curtain-raiser. Between rift with ICC and tricky conditions, do Pakistan have it in them to focus on the match?

No team wins T20 World Cup without beating India: WI head coach Darren Sammy T20 World Cup 2026: West Indies coach Daren Sammy reflected on past glories and urged his team to create history as they prepare for the T20 World Cup, underlining the formidable obstacle posed by India.

T20 World Cup to defend, home crowd to please and Suryakumar Yadav just smiling away T20 World Cup 2026: Suryakumar Yadav leads India under immense World Cup pressure with a constant smile. Calm in chaos, he trusts preparation and people, carrying expectation lightly as Indian captaincy demands everything.

T20 World Cup: Pakistan calling BCCI bullies is the easiest excuse, says Gavaskar Sunil Gavaskar hit back at Pakistan's claims of calling the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) bullies in the whole T20 World Cup controversy, with the nation opting to boycott their game against India. In the T20 World Cup roundtable hosted by Rajdeep Sardesai, Gavaskar said that the decision to remove Bangladesh from the tournament was one taken by a vote where 14 teams were for the move, while 2 other member nations were against it altogether.

How a WhatsApp message fuelled Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's 175 in the final A quiet WhatsApp reminder from his childhood coach preceded a night of calculated brutality. 14-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi dismantled England in the U19 World Cup final, hitting 175, including 15 sixes and as many boundaries in Harare on Friday.

Happy to carry ahead Rohit, Harmanpreet's legacy: Ayush chuffed after U19 WC win India's under-19 men's team won their sixth World Cup title, beating England by 100 runs. This victory completes a historic sweep of cricket world cups by all Indian teams of different age groups.

Kohli's message to India's U-19 team after World Cup win: Our domination continues Virat Kohli and Gautam Gambhir hailed India's U-19 World Cup triumph after a record sixth title, powered by Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's historic 175 in a dominant final win over England.

T20 World Cup: Mohammed Siraj replaces injured Harshit Rana in India's squad India have named senior pacer Mohammed Siraj as Harshit Rana's replacement after the fast bowler was ruled out of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 with a knee injury sustained during a warm-up match.

India win 6th U19 World Cup crown after Sooryavanshi 175 scorches England India lifted a sixth men's Under-19 World Cup title after Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's magnificent 175 laid the foundation for a dominant 100-run victory over England in the final at the Harare Sports Club on February, February 6.

Sourav Ganguly reacts to Pakistan's boycott stance against India in T20 World CupICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026: Sourav Ganguly expressed surprise at Pakistan's decision to boycott its T20 World Cup match against India, even as the tournament begins.

Olympian Sushil Kumar denied bail in fellow wrestler Sagar's murder caseA Delhi court on Friday dismissed Olympian Sushil Kumar's bail plea in the murder case of former junior national wrestling champion Sagar Dhankar at the Chhatrasal Stadium.

T20 World Cup: History up for grabs, but Surya wants India to stay in the momentT20 World Cup 2026 India vs USA: Speaking on the eve of India's opening game in Mumbai, captain Suryakumar Yadav spoke about the pressure of expectations, the weight of history and how India are trying to stay in the moment and get the job done. India are bidding to become the first team to defend the title and win the trophy as many as three times.

Suryakumar Yadav all but confirms Ishan Kishan as opener for USA clashIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav has almost confirmed Ishan Kishan as the opener for the T20 World Cup 2026 opening match against the USA. Kishan's explosive recent form has edged out Sanju Samson, signalling a fresh start for India's top order.

Pakistan should be banned for refusing to play India in T20 World Cup: Anurag ThakurICC T20 World Cup 2026: Former BCCI president and BJP MP, Anurag Thakur has called for the ICC to take strong action against Pakistan for their boycott of their group-stage game against India.

Vaibhav 175: No double, but he shatters records in U19 World Cup finalVaibhav Sooryavanshi produced one of the most commanding innings in Under-19 World Cup history, scoring a stunning 175 off 80 balls in the final of the ICC Men's Under-19 World Cup against England at Harare. The 14-year-old left-hander's knock put India in complete control of the title clash and left England struggling to contain the onslaught.

T20 World Cup likely to see its first 300-plus total, hints Harry BrookICC T20 World Cup 2026: England captain Harry Brook believes that the 2026 edition of the T20 World Cup might see its first 300+ total. Brook says that there are multiple Indian grounds where such high scores might be possible.

Bangladesh our brothers, hope they support us in T20 World Cup: Pakistan captainPakistan captain Salman Ali Agha on Thursday referred to Bangladesh as Pakistan's "brothers" and expressed hope that Bangladeshi fans would continue to back the Men in Green at the ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

Vaibhav Sooryavanshi scripts history, hits fastest U19 World Cup final hundredVaibhav Sooryavanshi scripted history in the U19 World Cup by hitting the fastest hundred in the final of the tournament. Vaibhav Sooryavanshi reached his century in 55 balls.

Injured Harshit Rana ruled out of T20 World Cup, set to undergo surgery: SourcesHarshit Rana has been ruled out of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup after sustaining an injury during a warm-up match against South Africa in Navi Mumbai on Wednesday. The Indian pacer is set to undergo surgery and is expected to be sidelined for a considerable period, sources have told India Today.

Despite criticism of ICC, Nasser Hussain named in T20 World Cup commentary panelFormer England captain Nasser Hussain has been named in the ICC's T20 World Cup 2026 commentary panel despite recently criticising the global body over governance, consistency and the treatment of Bangladesh and Pakistan.

Are ski-jumpers enhancing penis-size to fly further in Winter Olympics?A major controversy has brewed in the Winter Olympics. WADA is looking into allegations that ski jumpers are temporarily enhancing their penis sizes to fly further in their events.

IND vs ENG final Highlights: India clinch 6th title with 100-run victoryIndia (IND) vs England (ENG), U19 World Cup final Highlights: India have beaten England by 100 runs in the final and clinched their sixth Under-19 World Cup title. Vaibhav Suryavanshi starred in the summit clash with his sensational innings of 175 (80).

Australia hit by injury crisis, after Cummins, Hazlewood ruled out of T20 WCAustralia are in a major injury crisis right ahead of the T20 World Cup. After the exit of Pat Cummins, fast bowler Josh Hazlewood has been ruled out of the tournament.

Mandhana reveals how RCB took the Kohli way en route to title no.2 in WPLRCB captain Smriti Mandhana revealed that the one key thing that helped the side to their second WPL trophy. Mandhana in her post-match address, revealed that RCB had put a lot of work behind the scenes.

Heartbreak is their canvas: Delhi Capitals paint pain like Picasso in WPL historyWPL 2026: Delhi Capitals lost to Royal Challengers Bengaluru by six wickets in the WPL final on Thursday at the Kotambi Stadium in Vadodara. Jemimah Rodrigues-led DC became the first team in the tournament's history to win the Eliminator but fell short of lifting the WPL title.

Virat Kohli writes special message to Smriti Mandhana after RCB's 2nd WPL titleWPL: Royal Challengers Bengaluru became the first ever team in the history to hold the IPL and WPL titles together. After the historic feat, Virat Kohli penned a special message for RCB women's team captain Smriti Mandhana to congratulate the team.

U19 World Cup final: India eye record-extending 6th title, favourites vs EnglandU19 World Cup: India and England are set to lock horns in the grand finale on Friday, February 6. In the semi-final on Wednesday, India beat Afghanistan by seven wickets with a record run-chase in the tournament's history.

Yuzi Chahal tired of endless social media rumours: I know who I really amYuzvendra Chahal opens up on social media rumours, online trolling and fan wars, saying he ignores the noise and trusts his family and close friends.

Smriti Mandhana has gone through a lot, this win is for her: Shreyanka PatilWPL 2026 final: Shreyanka Patil dedicated RCB's historic second WPL title victory to Smriti Mandhana for leading the side once again after the personal setbacks she faced before the tournament.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
